reviews.text:
🦋This was such a beautiful place to travel to. Peaceful and tranquil it was and you really do feel at one with nature. You can sit with nature and listen to the waters dancing with the rocks or if you feel brave, why not take a walk or climb some hills and mountains. Snowdon isn’t too far from this spot either so if your feeling really adventurous and energetic and your fitness levels are good why not climb snowdon. 
As long as appropriately dressed and prepared (jackets, footwear, harness, hydration-water etc...) this will be a fantastic experience and also very good for the mind. Do it in a day or book one of the local hotels and do it over a few days. Nothing beats that feeling when you’re at peace with nature.
It caters for hikers , tourists with family plus it's a jewel of Wales worth a visit anytime

Food came quickly, chips weren't very hot but weren't greasy either.
Good choice of menu and the 2 ladies taking order's and getting the drinks were really polite and helpful.
Ice cream choices were excellent and portions really good.

This is a wonderful town in North Wales. The train station has a fabulous building that is still very Victorian in look and feel. You can get national rail trains from this station still but there is a great deal more to do there as well.  There are a number of cafés and shops to look at. There is also railway hobby shop over the track bridge to go and look at.
A true Welsh gem and fabulous scenery.
